intro: Calandrinia stenogyna, commonly known as the narrowleaf portulaca, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant red or pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include opposite leaves and capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. Calandrinia stenogyna is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
